metadata.title: CVE-2022-2906 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An attacker can leverage this flaw to gradually erode available memory tothe point where named crashes for lack of resources. Upon restart theattacker would have to begin again, but nevertheless there is the potentialto deny service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2906` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.10
bind9-dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.10
bind9-host - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.10
bind9-libs - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.10
bind9-utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.10
bind9utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.10
dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.10').
